sentences: Nam Tae-hyun (born May 10, 1994), also known as Taehyun, is a South Korean singer, songwriter, producer and actor.
section: N/A

sentences: In March 2017, he founded a music label, South Buyers Club.
section: N/A

sentences: Sometime afterwards, the label was renamed to The South.
section: N/A

sentences: Under the label, Nam debuted the band South Club, of which he is leader, main vocalist, guitarist, and main composer.
section: N/A

sentences: He was previously the main vocalist of K-pop group Winner, in which he also composed and produced.
section: N/A

sentences: In November 2019, Nam announced that he closed his music label and that the band had signed with new management.
section: N/A

== Life and career == | === 2014–2015: Official debut, 2014 S/S, and television appearances ===

sentences: Official debut, 2014 S/S, and television appearances ===
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–2015: Official debut, 2014 S/S, and television appearances ===

sentences: Nam participated in the production of Winner's debut album, 2014 S/S, which was released in August 2014.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–2015: Official debut, 2014 S/S, and television appearances ===

sentences: He co-composed three songs from the album – "But (사랑하지마)", "Tonight (이 밤)" and his solo track "Confession (고백하는거야)".
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–2015: Official debut, 2014 S/S, and television appearances ===

sentences: The album topped several charts, including the Gaon Music Chart as well as the Billboard's World Albums Chart.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–2015: Official debut, 2014 S/S, and television appearances ===

sentences: In 2015, while the group was on hiatus, Nam made his acting debut on web drama Midnight Girl.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–2015: Official debut, 2014 S/S, and television appearances ===

sentences: That same year, he played a supporting role in the drama Late Night Restaurant.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–2015: Official debut, 2014 S/S, and television appearances ===

sentences: He was also cast in the joint Chinese-Korean production Under the Black Moonlight.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–2015: Official debut, 2014 S/S, and television appearances ===
== Life and career == | === 2016: Exit : E, television appearances, and departure from Winner ===
== Life and career == | === 2016: Exit : E, television appearances, and departure from Winner ===

sentences: Exit : E, television appearances, and departure from Winner ===
section: == Life and career == | === 2016: Exit : E, television appearances, and departure from Winner ===

sentences: In January 2016, Nam released the single "Pricked" (사랑가시) in collaboration with Mino as a warm-up track ahead of Winner's EP Exit : E. The single charted at number two on MelOn.
section: == Life and career == | === 2016: Exit : E, television appearances, and departure from Winner ===

sentences: After nearly 18 months of hiatus, Winner's comeback mini-album Exit :
section: == Life and career == | === 2016: Exit : E, television appearances, and departure from Winner ===

sentences: E was released on February 1.
section: == Life and career == | === 2016: Exit : E, television appearances, and departure from Winner ===

sentences: The album featured five tracks, including "Pricked", and double title tracks "Baby Baby" and "센치해 (Sentimental)".
section: == Life and career == | === 2016: Exit : E, television appearances, and departure from Winner ===

sentences: Nam played a major role in the production of both title tracks, as well as for his solo "좋더라 (I'm Young)".
section: == Life and career == | === 2016: Exit : E, television appearances, and departure from Winner ===

sentences: In March 2016, Nam joined tvN's Actor School, a variety show featuring seven stars going through a series of trainings by actor Park Shin-yang, in order to brush up on their acting skills.
section: == Life and career == | === 2016: Exit : E, television appearances, and departure from Winner ===

sentences: On October 12, YG Entertainment stated that Nam would be halting promotional activities and receiving treatment for mental health issues.
section: == Life and career == | === 2016: Exit : E, television appearances, and departure from Winner ===

sentences: As a result, Winner's comeback was delayed indefinitely.
section: == Life and career == | === 2016: Exit : E, television appearances, and departure from Winner ===

sentences: Later, on November 25, it was announced that he had withdrawn from the group and had terminated his contract with YG Entertainment.
section: == Life and career == | === 2016: Exit : E, television appearances, and departure from Winner ===

sentences: The following day, he posted a handwritten letter on his personal Instagram account containing his apology, gratitude to fans and pledge to return with other music and projects.
section: == Life and career == | === 2016: Exit : E, television appearances, and departure from Winner ===
== Life and career == | === 2017–present: Music creations and South Buyers Club ===

sentences: 2017–present: Music creations and South Buyers Club ===
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: Music creations and South Buyers Club ===

sentences: Nam continues sharing his music creations and covers on his SoundCloud account, including a cover of Radiohead's "Creep", Park Hyo-shin's "Beautiful Tomorrow", and "Breath (숨)".
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: Music creations and South Buyers Club ===

sentences: His influences arise from artists across many genres, such as Nirvana, The Beatles, The Rolling Stones, B.B. King, and Eric Clapton.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: Music creations and South Buyers Club ===

sentences: He then created a Tumblr site on January 5, posting announcements and communicating with fans from time to time.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: Music creations and South Buyers Club ===

sentences: On January 23, Nam started recruiting applications for his upcoming band.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: Music creations and South Buyers Club ===

sentences: On March 25, Nam, together with his rumored band, South Club, held a guerrilla show at Pet Sounds Bar in Korea.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: Music creations and South Buyers Club ===

sentences: The 30-minute show was livestreamed on platforms such as Instagram, and popular China video-sharing platform Miaopai.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: Music creations and South Buyers Club ===

sentences: South Club performed a total of four songs, including tracks from The Beatles and Foster the People.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: Music creations and South Buyers Club ===

sentences: On April 11, Nam announced that his music label "South Buyers Club" has officially been registered as of March 30.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: Music creations and South Buyers Club ===

sentences: On May 26, South Club released the music video for their first pre-release track "Hug Me," which was a ballad rock track.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: Music creations and South Buyers Club ===

sentences: South Club's first EP 90 was released on June 27, along with music videos for the two title tracks: "Liar" and "I got the Blues.".
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: Music creations and South Buyers Club ===

sentences: The name of the album was inspired by the expression of freedom of youths in the 90s.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: Music creations and South Buyers Club ===

sentences: It was also due to the fact that all members of the band were born after the year 1990.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: Music creations and South Buyers Club ===

sentences: On July 9, the band came back with their first single titled "아니 (No)".
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: Music creations and South Buyers Club ===

sentences: After the member Yooni's departure, the band's first release as a four piece was the second single "누굴 위한 노래인가요 (Who Is This Song For?)", which became available for streaming on December 5, 2017.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: Music creations and South Buyers Club ===
== Life and career == | === Radio DJ ===

sentences: Radio DJ ===
section: == Life and career == | === Radio DJ ===

sentences: On July 31, 2017, Nam started his career as a radio DJ.
section: == Life and career == | === Radio DJ ===

sentences: He broadcast live on the Casper Radio Vlive channel on Mondays, at 11pm, to talk about various topics and to share his music with his fans.
section: == Life and career == | === Radio DJ ===

sentences: On his 32nd broadcast, on April 9, 2018, Nam announced that he would be doing his last broadcast on May 7, in order to focus more on his music.
section: == Life and career == | === Radio DJ ===

sentences: Personal life ==
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Following the suicide of fellow K-pop idol and actress Sulli in October 2019, Nam spoke out against cyberbullying and malicious commenting by netizens, stating that he had previously attempted suicide because of similar harassment.
